summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) report regarding an incident report against inmate Jeffrey Epstein for self-mutilation (Code 228) on July 23, 2019. The DHO found insufficient evidence, and the report was expunged on August 1, 2019.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was the subject of a Bureau of Prisons disciplinary report for alleged self-mutilation (Code 228) on July 23, 2019, while incarcerated at MCC New York.
The Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) expunged the incident report on August 1, 2019, finding insufficient evidence to support the charge.
The document shows the formal disciplinary process within the Bureau of Prisons, including notice of charges, rights advisement, a hearing, and a finding.
This hearing occurred shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
